name: Golan
info: A Sinner adept at defending. Can block 2 enemies at the same time and increase Max HP by 10%.

exclusiveCrimebrand.name: Ostrich Freedom
exclusiveCrimebrand.description: New Exclusive Ultimate [Ostrich Freedom]. Golan uses her mechanical parasol to strafe enemies within the 3x3 square range ahead, dealing #(Golan's HP * 40% / 60% / 80%)# Physical Damage and 1 Core Damage. When hitting a target with the [Weakspot] mark, [Ostrich Freedom] removes the mark and deals 1 Core Damage additionally. Golan gains 12 Energy when removing a [Weakspot] mark this way. [Ostrich Freedom] has a 10-second cooldown after each use and can only be used twice per battle.

ecbFlavourText:
"Run away...? Yes, run away..."
"Pretend none of this ever happened..."

maniaIntensify.title: Winning Streak
maniaIntensify.text: When an enemy receives a [Weakspot] mark, Golan recovers #2.5%# of her Max HP.

criminalRecord:
The heir to a Syndican gang involved in numerous shootouts there and entangled with various gang factions. The subject's suspected of dabbling in the underground circulation of Mania weapons and hence poses a significant threat. Immediate detention is recommended.

--

It has now been confirmed that the subject's gang was not involved in the circulation of Mania weapons. Her awakening was triggered by forced contact with Mania due to an attack, not out of her own volition. Kind and innocent in nature, the subject got involved in street brawls to protect her family. Under the Bureau's rehabilitation and supervision, she is confirmed to no longer be a threat.
mutationAssessment:
+++* Ability Summary
Capable of transmuting an object by touch, the subject can convert a parasol into a tough weapon by turning its cover into the alloy constituting its handle, as well as harden various materials and fire them as bullets.

+++* Awakening Signs
When the subject witnessed her first ever Syndican gang fight, she was attacked by a Mania weapon and got infected with Mania. During the subsequent clash, the subject's strong desire to protect her family and resistance to the unfolding events triggered the awakening of her power.

+++* Corruption State
The subject's level of corruption is low and her physical features are no different from that of a normal person. However, her mental state is unstable, often showing abnormal tendencies such as impulsiveness and overreaction.

guide.title: Summary
guide.text:
Golan is a part of the "Weakspot team", whose core members are Bianca & Shawn. Golan can provide [Weakspot] application with her Ultimate and P1, some Core Damage with her ECB Ultimate, and impressive Physical dmg amp for Bianca with her P2.

Golan is not a must for WS team and can be substituted by other meta ampers if you wish, especially pre-S2. However, S0 Golan is fine to use and nicely cheap to build since the only important skill to level is her P2. Lvl 70 S0 1119 Golan still provides a 28% Phys Dmg buff for Bianca. With Golan's S2, this buff would be increased to 42%.

crimebrandSets.name: Justice + Corridor
crimebrandSets.note: Buff the whole team's Attack by 5% whenever Golan Ults.

crimebrandSets.name: Afterglow + Corridor
crimebrandSets.note: Boosts nearby allied Sinners' Attack by 10% after Golan uses Ult. Although the Attack increase provided is larger than Justice, Afterglow has a 20s cooldown and does not apply mapwide, making it more difficult to use.

crimebrandSets.name: Nightmare + Hope
crimebrandSets.note: Provides allied Sinners an Atk and Atkspd boost for the first 30 seconds of battle. Good in BFL.

crimebrandSets.name: Rift + Corridor
crimebrandSets.note: Can be used in long battles VS high DEF bosses such as ToA. Reduces target enemy's Defense.

crimebrandSets.name: Heartache + Corridor
crimebrandSets.note: A good choice for BFL as her ECB can deal 2 corebreaks, setting up Bianca for a good burst phase. Make sure Golan is the last one to corebreak the boss if you use this for the effect to work.

crimebrandSets.name: Fury + Bulwark + Palace
crimebrandSets.note: Increases Golan's block count, heals her when she Ults, and debuffs the damage of enemies that hit her. Recommended for content where Golan is used as a tank, such as Mania Training.

crimebrandSets.name: Host + Bulwark
crimebrandSets.note: Alternative set for tanking if you don't have Rift Palace.

shackles.title: Battle Will Reforged
shackles.description: [Material Inheritance] can now be stacked up to 3 times.

shackles.title: Emotion Resonance
shackles.description: Ultimate Energy Consumption reduced by 3 points.

skills.name: Parasol Strike
skills.description: Golan attacks with her mechanical parasol, dealing (Attack * 87.2%) Physical Damage each time.

skills.name: Strike Back at Will

upgrade.description: HP bonus increases to $0%.</br>Damage increases to $0%.

skills.description:
Golan enters a [Counterstrike Stance]. She gains a #12%# Max HP boost, stops normal attack, and uses [Pellet Shower] on enemies within skill range every 3 seconds, dealing #(her Max HP * 30%)# Physical Damage. [Counterstrike Stance] lasts 10 seconds, during which Golan cannot automatically recover Energy. [Pellet Shower] applies a [Weakspot] mark on enemies, lasting until the end of the battle.
[Weakspot]: Prioritized as the attack target, superseding the [Taunt] effect.

skills.name: Street Brawl
skills.description:
Golan gains 1 stack of [Gear Up] every #20# seconds, stacking up to once only.
[Gear Up]: While not in [Counterstrike Stance], Golan uses one stack of [Gear Up] to immediately cast [Pellet Shower] once after moving.

skills.name: Material Inheritance
skills.description: When allied Sinners remove a [Weakspot] mark, they gain a #8%# Physical Damage boost for 10 seconds, stacking up to 2 times.

Unlock File: Performance in Serving Term, Unlock Voice: Full Compliance, Unlock Sinner Title: TBA
maniaIntensifyText: When enemies on the battlefield are attached with [Weakspot], Golan restores 2.5% of her Max HP.
arrestRec1: While hiding in a residential home in Syndicate, the subject issued a bounty on the dark web for an intel-gathering job. Her identity as a Sinner was exposed following her contact with Chief. The subject was then detained by Chief after the MBCC Chief Kidnapping Case.
arrestRec2: The subject was born into the Iron Gang, a medium-sized Syndican gang led by her mother. Kept isolated deliberately by her parents, she's only acquired basic self-defense skills as the heir and is still unaware of the dangerous situation she's in.
arrestRec3: The subject's special power is coveted by all the gangs and the Iron Gang is often besieged by massive attacks consequentially. To avoid burdening her family, the subject has left the gang of her own accord and strives to present herself as a lady to dissociate herself from the underworld and sever ties with her past.
arrestRec4: The Iron Gang was initially established around debt collection businesses. The subject once openly surrendered during a gang clash, which led to the MBCC being mistakenly regarded as her backing force. The other gangs' wariness has since favored the Iron Gang's development.
servingTerm1: The subject has a deep bond with her family. When she missed home during her early days of detention, she would call her family discreetly and hang up quietly as soon as they answered just to confirm their safety.
servingTerm2: The subject is a loyal fan of DeadLover Radio and enjoys listening to sensational stories. She takes the host's exaggerated remarks a little too seriously and even imitates her.
servingTerm3: With her poor acting skills, the subject can't maintain her ladylike image for more than a few hours, often becoming irritated after repeatedly having to hold back on swearing and eventually revealing her true nature. Many Syndican Sinners get along with the subject and commend her for taking the blame after collaborative mischief.
servingTerm4: The subject is keen on studying ladylike looks in TV dramas, often seeking Chief's opinions on outfit ideas. If an outfit receives praise from Chief, the subject will wear it without hesitation and refuses to take it off even when her taste gets questioned by the artistic Sinners.
emotionCheck1:
[Golan is glued to her terminal, reading the posts on an MBCC intranet forum.] 

**Golan:** Ah, so-and-so and so-and-so are sworn brothers, and so-and-so and so-and-so don't see eye to eye. Here comes a big one: Chief had a thing for that beautiful lady sent by the forces of evil... 

**Chief:** ......


* **Prompt:** Don't tell me you actually believe this ridiculous piece of gossip? 
 * **Golan:** What?! It's fake news? Damn it, I made a donation to that poster. Wait a minute! I remember DeadLover Radio broadcast something in a similar vein. Could these two sources be wrong at the same time? 
 * **Golan:** ğŸ˜«ğŸ˜«ğŸ˜«


* **Prompt:** I have no idea what you're talking about. 
 * **Golan:** Ha! You're hiding something. You did fall for her, didn't you? Come on, spill it out! Were you madly in love with each other? And when you went your separate ways, you swore never to fall in love ever again? 
 * **Golan:** ğŸ˜˜ğŸ˜˜ğŸ˜˜
emotionCheck2:
[Golan drools over the expensive limited-edition plush accessory listed in Faye's product catalog.]

**Golan:** Damn it, money is short! I can't hire myself out as a henchman. That's not allowed around here. So how am I going to swindle... no, make some money? Ha, I've got it! I can be an information broker! 

**Chief:** ......

* **Prompt:** Are you going to sell stories about love-hate relationships where the truth is unknown? 
 * **Golan:** Isn't that the nature of information brokering? I provide the information; you pay for it. Whether it's true or false, that's beyond my control. But rest assured, I won't lie to you intentionally, and if it happens unintentionally, well... there's nothing I can do about that. 
 * **Golan:** ğŸ˜˜ğŸ˜˜ğŸ˜˜

* **Prompt:** Are you going to sell well-thought-out reports on current events? 
 * **Golan:** That sounds like a premium product to me. I don't sell that kind of stuff. N-Not because I can't, but because no information broker in their right mind would take on such a thankless job. 
 * **Golan:** ğŸ˜«ğŸ˜«ğŸ˜«
supervision1:
++* âš  A Runaway

//In a fit of rage, Golan storms out of the Bureau.//

**System Notifications:** After being told by some of the staff that the color of her sash bow clashes with that of her dress, Golan declares she'll leave the Bureau and storms off. According to the surveillance cameras, she lingers just outside the perimeter walls until late at night before returning to the detention area.

* **Prompt:** Leave her alone for a while
supervision2:
++* âš  An Honorable Thief

//The cafeteria's snacks are gone.//

**System Notifications:** The snack cabinet was raided last night. An investigation is conducted. Nino, Hella, and EMP, all looking shifty, sneak away during the investigation, while Golan stays put, confessing that she ate three chicken legs and five bags of potato chips, and drank seven bottles of milk tea.

* **Prompt:** Reprimand them
supervision3:
++* âš  Tales of Yesteryear

//The hypnotherapist sends you a message.//

**System Notifications:** During therapy sessions, Golan has a habit of telling her therapist fictitious tales about her past, a habit that greatly undermines the effectiveness of the sessions.

* **Prompt:** Be patient; don't expose her just yet
supervision4:
++* âš âš  A Glamorous Picnic

//Golan is overdressed for a Bureau picnic.//

**System Notifications:** The Bureau has organized a picnic. You arrive at the appointed location ahead of time to make sure everything is in order, only to find you're not the first one to arrive.

**Golan:** ****! This outfit is so uncomfortable!

**System Notifications:** Golan is standing with her back to you, straightening her clothes. She's dressed differently today, in a resplendent dress with a long train and a wide-brimmed hat.

* **Prompt:** Greet

**Chief:** Golan?

**Golan:** Ah, Chief!

**Chief:** You're all dressed up. What for?

**Golan:** For the picnic. Why else? Aren't people supposed to be dressed to the nines for picnics around here?

**Chief:** Picnics must be a big deal in Syndicate, yes?

**Golan:** Yes. And I heard it on DeadLover Radio: In Syndicate, formal attire should be worn for a picnic!

**Golan:** Wearing your best dress, eating desserts, drinking tea, engaging in conversationâ€”these are key components of a normal picnic.

**Chief:** Which episode of DeadLover Radio are you talking about?

**Golan:** //Crack Dress Codes: How to Dress for Social Media Success//

**System Notifications:** Noticing the persistent frown on your face, Golan seems to realize that something is off.

**Golan:** What's with that expression?

**Golan:** Wait a second. Why are you wearing the Bureau uniform?!

* **Prompt:** Tease her

**Chief:** It was an oversight. I'll go change now. You wait here for the others.

**System Notifications:** You turn around to leave, but before you can walk a few meters away, Golan catches up with you and stops you.

**Golan:** Hey, could you please stop for a second? Here is the thing. I've... I've never participated in an ordinary activity like this before.

**Golan:** I demand... I hope you can tell me what kind of clothes people usually wear to such activities.

**Chief:** Just the regular kind.

**Chief:** The picnic is not for another half an hour. Go get changed now, and you'll be back here in time for the event, I'm sure.

**System Notifications:** Golan mimes zipping her lips while staring at you, her way of telling you not to breathe a word. Then she hitches up the skirts of her dress and runs back to her room.
supervision5:
++* âš âš  An Unarguable Recap

//To improve her odds of winning her next argument with Hella, Golan becomes a fervent writer.//

**System Notifications:** It's a new day. In the library, Golan sits hunched over a notebook. She is writing away on it, a solemn expression on her face.
It's rare to see her in the library, and even rarer to see her studying hard in the library.

* **Prompt:** Ask about Golan's studies

**Chief:** Golan, what are you studying?

**System Notifications:** She hastily covers up her notebook, but you still catch a glimpse of what looks to be a written dialogue.

**Golan:** Nothing. It's nothing. It's for my eyes only!

**System Notifications:**
[[[Hella]]]: ****
Me: ****
Hella: ****
Me: Right back at you! (She's really good at this, so I had to bring out the big guns.)
Hella: Ineffective comeback.

**Chief:** ...What was that?!

**System Notifications:** Golan looks a bit embarrassed, and then answers you in a lowered voice.

**Golan:** It's a recap of my argument with Hella...

**Chief:** You two argued again?

**Golan:** She started it! And [[[Mess]]], that little ****... (Coughs) She made it worse.

**Golan:** I'm making this recap to find out where I didn't perform well in the latest argument, so I can beat Hella in the next argument.

* **Prompt:** Will it work?

**Golan:** Of course it will! I've thought of a killer comeback for what Hella said.
baseVoicelines:
[Obtain the Sinner]
Oh fu... ahem, who are you looking for? Syndicate gang? Sinner? I wouldn't dare touch these businesses! How could a refined girl like me be involved with the Iron Gang, haha.

[Raise to Phase 1]
I really gotta practice harder, or those kids are gonna have a real laugh.

[Raise to Phase 3]
Now, I am powerful enough to take lead of the family, standing proud, in front of my peers.

[Level Start]
Stay back. Don't poke your head out.

[Win Battles]
Weren't ya causing a scene back then? Well then why don't you continue!

[Lose Battles]
Think you're tough? I dare you to come to the back door, you and me!

[Ultimate Skill]
Messing with MY people? Die!

[Die in Battles]
At least... this time... I didn't run away...

[Greeting]
You're back! Did you get the fluffy thing you promised me? Just had a big figh... big party with them, the decorations on my umbrella were all torn off...

[Conversation 1]
You've been to so many places, tell me, what are the girls in Eastside wearing lately?

[Conversation 2]
Hmm... the wound is covered with a cute band-aid, and the collar torn during the fight is pinned with a pretty brooch, now I should look fine... Oh fuâ€”Ah!  Hello, Chief! Since when were you here?

[Conversation 3]
Now that I think about it, my life wasn't too far from ordinary. It's just eating, chatting, fighting with rival gangs, working out, sleeping...

[Special Conversation 1]


[Special Conversation 2]


[Special Conversation 3]


[Full Compliance]
I used to be a coward who only hid under the umbrella and relied on others to protect me... But now, you gave me the courage to face everything on my own, and to find a way to protect the family with my own strength. From now on, I will carry this umbrella, stand firm, and protect everyone I care about.

[Idle]
Hair, good, accessories, good, cute umbrella, good, mindset, good~ Today, I remain the cutest ******* little girl in Syndicate!

[Annoyed]
These jingling and jangling shits are kinda cute, but they ******* dangle too much!

[Special Attention]
Wha... what are you looking at? Is there... something weird about me?!

[Dispatch]
Chief, let's talk this over, can we, like, not go to Syndicate? That place... uh, it really scares me! Definitely not because I'm afraid of being seen by someone...

[Dispatch Complete]
That was nothing scary! Got some loot for ya!

[Level Up]
That's show ya!!! Um, I mean... how impressive!

voicelines.Special Conversation 1 - EN: You should know by now that I'm the heir to the Iron Gang, but don't worry, I won't go anywhere. After all, if I go back all of a sudden, I might bring them even bigger trouble...

voicelines.Special Conversation 2 - EN: When you go on a mission to Syndicate, if you see those brats doing something bad, you can use my name to teach them a lesson! But don't use real weapons, after all, they're my boys...

voicelines.Special Conversation 3 - EN: Being found out to be a Sinner in Syndicate is really troublesome, I have to do a dozen more fights every day. I can endure people looking for trouble, but my boys did nothing wrong to bear this with me... So I told myself: run, run to a place where no one knows you.

voicelines.Full Compliance - EN: I used to be a coward who only hid under the umbrella and relied on others to protect me... But now, you gave me the courage to face everything on my own, and to find a way to protect the family with my own strength. From now on, I will carry this umbrella, stand firm, and protect everyone I care about.

supervision6:
++* âš âš âš  An Ordinary Sinner

//Golan is often seen staring at other Sinners with an unnerving intensity.//

**System Notifications:** You've received multiple complaints from the staff against Golan. According to these complaints, Golan has the peculiar habit of standing in the corner of this or that common area at the Bureau and staring at other Sinners with an unnerving intensity.

* **Prompt:** Find Golan

**System Notifications:** When you find Golan, she is standing in the corner of the cafeteria, an intense look in her eyes.

**Chief:** What are you doing here?

**Golan:** Just... standing.

**Chief:** Yesterday, you were standing in the corner of the Recreation Area. The day before yesterday, you were standing in the corner of the Training Room.

**Chief:** Is this a new hobby of yours, standing in corners for long periods of time?

**Golan:** You're following me?!

**Chief:** You're too out there.

**System Notifications:** Golan's face turns red.

**Chief:** Now, tell me what you're really up to.

**Golan:** I'm trying to find out how ordinary Sinners live their lives.

**Chief:** Ordinary Sinners?

**Golan:** I don't have to pretend to be a normal person anymore. I'm embracing my identity as a Sinner.

**Golan:** But I don't know what an ordinary Sinner is supposed to be like...

**Golan:** These past few days, I've been observing the other Sinners. I'm more confused now than I was a few days ago. Everyone is different; I don't know who to imitate...

* **Prompt:** Just be yourself.

**Chief:** You don't need to imitate anyone. Just be yourself. Here at the Bureau, Sinners and non-Sinners are treated the same.

**Golan:** Huh?! What the... The thing you just said...

**Golan:** D-Did you really mean it?

* **Prompt:** Compliment her on her competence as a Sinner
 * **Chief:** I did. Everyone at the Bureau knows how good a fighter you are. Just remember, everyone here has their own unordinary abilities.
 * **Golan:** I see... I //am// a normal person, just like everybody else. And me being a Sinner doesn't change that fact.

* **Prompt:** Compliment her on how well-adjusted she is
 * **Chief:** You get on well with both the staff and the other Sinners. Everyone likes you. The way I see it, you've fully integrated into the life here.
 * **Chief:** I'm surprised that you don't feel like an ordinary Sinner.
 * **Golan:** You are? Hmm, arguing, eating, training... The other Sinners do these things too.
